SENT.plain: A kindred with a history of multiple thromboses was studied for coagulant abnormalities
A deficiency of serum antithrombin III was found in approximately half of the 13 family members by either coagulant or immunologic assay
No clear relationship between antithrombin III deficiency and a history of thrombosis was present
Platelet antithrombin assays were also studied in the same subjects
Ten of the 13 members were deficient
None of the remaining three had a history of thrombosis

On the basis of these findings, the hypothesis is proposed that in some cases familial hypercoagulability may be due to a platelet antithrombin deficiency and that the serum antithrombin III deficiency in some cases is a secondary rather than a primary effect
